page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY OF FRILSHAM
page.content: The village of{Frilsham}is in Berkshire 8 miles from{Newbury}and 10 miles from{Reading.}Its name originally Fripels Ham was Frilesham in the 11th century and Frylesham by the 16th. The area of the parish is 978 acres. It is without a centre. There is an area of recreation land but it can hardly be called a village green. It has{240 inhabitants}and is the hub of the farming community. There are few{amenities}in the village itself; no shop, no school, no garage, no post-office. It is a quiet peaceful place in beautiful countryside and has changed little over the years. It could be very frustrating for young people-there is nothing for them to do! It is dominated by its beautiful church. It has retained a nineteenth century character though motor car and telephone have changed{village life.}
